title: Is philosophy the spirit of physics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well….. No. Physics is a branch of scientific inquiry and relies on the observable and testable…. Just like any other scientific endeavor. There may be aspects of philosophy involved in things like “how do we formulate scientific questions”…. People refer to the “philosophy of science”, for instance. But in reality, philosophy and science split as disciplines a long time ago.

Basically, philosophy is “the spirit of physics”. The research, study, and thought of phenomena, whether physical or metaphysical were operations conducted by persons called “philosophers”. The reason is that all of the sciences have their origin in the domain of philosophy. The sciences were a branch of philosophy called “natural philosophy”.
